Class ParticleImpl

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--edu.rit.m2mi.nbodies1.ParticleImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
Particle
public class ParticleImpl
extends Object
implements Particle

Class ParticleImpl encapsulates a charged particle in a two-dimensional N Bodies Simulation.

M2MI Library Version 02-Jul-2002

Constructor Summary

Constructor Detail

ParticleImpl

public ParticleImpl(int id,
                    double c,
                    double posX,
                    double poxY,
                    double velX,
                    double velY)
             throws SynthesisException
Construct a new particle.

Parameters:
id - Particle ID.
c - Particle charge.
posX - X coordinate of particle initial position.
velX - X coordinate of particle initial velocity.
velY - Y coordinate of particle initial velocity.
Throws:
SynthesisException - Thrown if there was a problem synthesizing handle classes.
Method Detail

start

public void start()
Start the simulation. Report this particle's charge and position.

Specified by:
start in interface Particle

report

public void report(int id,
                   double c,
                   double x,
                   double y)
Report some particle's charge and position. Accumulate that information into the calculation of this particle's velocity for the next time step.

Specified by:
report in interface Particle
Parameters:
id - Particle ID.
c - Charge.
x - X position.
y - Y position.

step

public void step(double dt)
Take a time step. Move this particle according to its current velocity for the given amount of time, then report this particle's charge and new position.

Specified by:
step in interface Particle
Parameters:
dt - Size of time step.
